bug.short_desc: Location bar menu disappears after mouse pointer hovers over menu, but over only after computer is "awaken" from sleep mode

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
After the computer "awakens" from sleeping, or hibernation and Firefox is still open, the Location Bar's drop down menu does not function properly. When the pointer opens the drop down menu, and begins to hover over the menu, the menu disappears. This issue seems to extend to the "right click" menus as well. The issue only goes away after the Firefox window is minimized then maximized.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.Open Firefox 2.Place computer into Sleep/Hibernation mode. 3.Awaken computer. 4.Click on location menu. 5.Hover pointer over menu. Actual Results: The menu disappears.
Expected Results: Pointer should be able to hover over menu and click on entries.
I put a lock on my computer where I must input my password to unlock computer after sleeping/hibernation.
